titleStmt.title: Votes of the Honorable House of Commons against protections. Lune 19⁰ die Decembris, 1670. Information being given of a great scandal and reflection upon the honor and justice of this House, by several persons, shop-keepers, tradesmen, and others, sheltring themselves under the colour of protections of Parliament-priviledge, against the due course of law, to evade satisfaction of their just debts ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

titleStmt.title: Votes of the Honorable House of Commons against protections. Lune 19⁰ die Decembris, 1670. Information being given of a great scandal and reflection upon the honor and justice of this House, by several persons, shop-keepers, tradesmen, and others, sheltring themselves under the colour of protections of Parliament-priviledge, against the due course of law, to evade satisfaction of their just debts ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

publicationStmt.publisher: In the Savoy, printed by Tho. Newcomb.,

notesStmt.note: Title includes first five lines of text.
